Part A - SQL

Core SQL Queries

1. List the total budget allocated for projects in each country, along with the count of projects per country. Display sorted by the total budget in descending order

Table 1 presents the total budget allocated for projects in each country, along with the number of projects per country

Table 1: Project count and budget per country
Country TotalBudget ProjectCount
Spain 650000 2
UK 550000 2
Netherlands 400000 1
Italy 250000 1
France 200000 1
Germany 150000 1

2. List the average development time for projects, categorized by the number of assets used

Table 2 presents the average development time for projects, grouped by the number of assets used

Table 2: Average development time for projects, grouped by
AverageDevTime AssetCount
258.25 0
212.50 10
181.50 11

3. List the top three developers based on the number of successful projects they’ve been involved in. Display the results

Table 3 presents the 3 developers with the highest number of completed projects

Table 3: Developers with the highest number of successful projects
Name SuccessfulProjects
Morgan Lee 2
Jordan Kim 1
Alice Johnson 1

General SQL Concepts

1. SELECT with LIKE and OR

Table 4 presents all developers with “designer” or “engineer” in their specialization, ordered by years of experience

Table 4: Years of experience amongst designers and engineers
Name Specialization ExperienceYears
Dave Brown Game Designer 6
Frank Miller Sound Engineer 5
Henry Moore UI/UX Designer 4
Grace Wilson Level Designer 2

2. SELECT with DISTINCT and ORDER BY

Table 5 presents the names of all project leads

Table 5: Project leads
Name
Alice Johnson
Jordan Kim
Karen Garcia
Morgan Lee

3. Subquery with SELECT

Table 6 presents the names and specializations of all developers who have worked on more than 1 project
